channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nissan’s next CEO says it needs partners and he’s open to Honda
item.description: “A CEO is normally dealing with one or two major crises in his or her career. I’m gonna have to deal with four or five at the same time."

item.title: A Fire Plunged Heathrow Into Darkness. A Nearby Data Center Kept Humming. Why?

item.title: Trump SSA nominee and self-proclaimed ‘DOGE person’ gets Senate hearing as Democrat decries ‘wholesale effort to dismantle Social Security’

item.title: A Traditional Ramadan Treat Gets a Modern Remake (but Good Luck Getting It)
item.description: Marook, a sweet bread eaten during Ramadan in Syria, used to be a simple loaf, but now the list of choices can be as long as the lines of customers.

item.title: A Hiring Binge Abroad
item.description: We cover a new kind of offshore office park.

item.title: Months after calling Wizz Air’s unlimited flights deal a ‘marketing scam’, Michael O’Leary’s Ryanair launches its own subscription service
item.description: Michael O'Leary mocked Wizz Air's "All You Can Fly" deal as a marketing stunt. Now he's letting Ryanair passengers spend £79 on a "Prime" deal.

item.title: Trump signs order to make voters show proof of citizenship in elections, with swift pushback expected from states which set their own voting rules

item.title: Meet the March Madness millionaires: From Duke’s Cooper Flagg to Purdue’s Braden Smith, college athletes are raking in eight-figure NIL deals
item.description: Through NIL deals, college athletes can earn their own money from using their image.

item.description: It remains unclear if a deal to ensure safe shipping in the Black Sea, which came with many caveats, could come into effect soon.
